slides.title: Introduction to Forecasting
slides.content:
# Business Forecasting üìà

Predicting the future to plan today.

## What is Forecasting?

Using historical data and analysis to predict future values.

## Why Forecast?

- Inventory planning
- Budgeting
- Staffing
- Capacity planning

## Types of Forecasts

| Type | Horizon | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| Short-term | Days-weeks | Daily sales |
| Medium-term | Months | Quarterly budget |
| Long-term | Years | Market trends |

> üí° All forecasts are wrong‚Äîsome are useful!

slides.title: Forecasting Methods
slides.content:
# Forecasting Methods üîß

## Qualitative Methods
- Expert judgment
- Delphi method
- Market research

## Quantitative Methods

### Time Series
- Moving averages
- Exponential smoothing
- ARIMA

### Causal/Regression
- Linear regression
- Multiple regression
- ML models

## Method Selection

| Situation | Method |
|-----------|--------|
| No historical data | Qualitative |
| Stable patterns | Time series |
| Causal relationships | Regression |
| Complex patterns | ML |

> üéØ Start simple, add complexity as needed!

# Simple Forecasting Techniques üìä

## Moving Average

Average of last n periods.

**SMA = (Y‚ÇÅ + Y‚ÇÇ + ... + Y‚Çô) / n**

## Exponential Smoothing

Weighted average favoring recent data.

**F‚Çú‚Çä‚ÇÅ = Œ± √ó Y‚Çú + (1-Œ±) √ó F‚Çú**

## Trend Analysis

Fit linear trend to data.

**Y = a + bt**

## Seasonal Adjustment

1. Calculate seasonal indices
2. Deseasonalize data
3. Forecast trend
4. Reapply seasonality

```python
import numpy as np

data = [100, 120, 130, 125, 140, 150]
sma_3 = np.convolve(data, np.ones(3)/3, mode='valid')
print(f"3-period SMA: {sma_3}")
```

slides.title: Forecast Accuracy
slides.content:
# Measuring Forecast Accuracy üìè

## Error Metrics

### MAE (Mean Absolute Error)
Average of absolute errors.

### MAPE (Mean Absolute % Error)
**MAPE = (100/n) √ó Œ£|Actual - Forecast|/Actual**

### RMSE
Root Mean Square Error‚Äîpenalizes large errors.

## Accuracy Guidelines

| MAPE | Interpretation |
|------|---------------|
| < 10% | Highly accurate |
| 10-20% | Good |
| 20-50% | Reasonable |
| > 50% | Inaccurate |

## Best Practices

- Track bias (over/under)
- Use holdout validation
- Compare multiple methods
- Update models regularly
